This app fails at the most basic thing: logging into my account. And it fails in a revealing and concerning way! The crash makes me seriously question whether any part of the app is secure. Technical details follow: the app crashes with an error indicating JSON parse failure. For some reason, the password is concatenated plain-text into a would-be JSON string. Note that my password contains a backslash \ that isn't followed by any valid JSON escape character. (When I type my password and add another \ so that the JSON string will escape properly, login is successful. That is not a good user experience.) In other words: prior to concatenation, the password is not hashed (preferred) and also not properly escaped (which is necessary when not hashed). So the JSON parser crashes the entire app because the password value is not a correct string. What would happen if I typed a closing " and provided my own custom JSON as part of the password entry? Anyway, the fact that a password is included plain-text into a JSON string introduces serious concerns that this app is not properly securing my account credentials. And with that being the case, what else is it not securing?
